Major_Arcs.title: The Ghost Town Transformation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting of Ghost Town, the characters Nan and Cal, and the impending transformation of the town due to airport construction, leading to Nan's emotional distress and shift in perspective.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Discontent and Airport Announcement
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets the stage with Nan's dissatisfaction with Ghost Town, her rejection of Cal, and the subsequent arrival of men discussing plans to build an airport, revealing the town's impending demolition.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Rejection and the Ghost Town Mystery
Cal's Frustrated Departure from Ghost Town
Arrival at Merrick Gulch and the 'Ghost Town' Label
Airport Development Plans for the Ghost Town
Nan's Distress and Realization of Ghost Town's Demolition

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Practicality Amidst Change
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Nan's changed perspective after learning about the airport, leading to her apology to Cal and a more practical view of the town's future, contrasted with Cal's cynical romanticism.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Apology and Practical View of the Airport
Nan's Reflection on Her Harsh Reaction to Cal
Cal's Cynical Monologue on Love and Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Growing Distress
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts the tone to danger and confrontation as Nan faces unwanted advances from rough men, escalating her distress and highlighting the town's changing atmosphere.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Rough Men and Nan's Resistance

Major_Arcs.title: Family, Romance, and Airport Realities
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores Nan's familial relationships, romantic entanglements with Cal, and her struggle to reconcile her romanticized view of life with the practical realities of the airport development.

sub_scenes.title: Practical Airport Justifications and Father-Daughter Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the practical aspects of the airport, with rough men discussing its benefits, and then shifts to domestic conflict between Nan and her father regarding the airport and her role.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Airport Frustration and Father's Dismissiveness
Horses for Construction and Father-Daughter Argument

sub_scenes.title: Humiliation, Advice, and Resolve
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene portrays Nan's emotional low point after the argument, her introspection in bed, and the contrasting advice she receives from her mother, father, and maid regarding love and her relationship with Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Humiliation and Reflection in Bed
Mother's Advice on Love and Childishness
Father's Pragmatic Advice to Focus on Cal
Maid's Reassurance of Cal's Love and Need for Patience
Nan's Resolve to Know Cal's True Feelings

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit of Clarity and Ranch Duties
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Nan acting on her resolve by pursuing Cal, but her romantic pursuit is interrupted by ranch duties and a new conflict with her father regarding a deal.

narrative_arcs.title: Horses Arriving and Ranch Hand's Request for Help
Argument with Father About a Deal

Major_Arcs.title: Emotional Rollercoaster and Reunion
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Nan and Cal's emotional journey, from confession and explanation to separation, loneliness, and finally, a heartfelt reunion and confession of love.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confession and Abrupt Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan and Cal's emotional exchange, where Nan confesses her feelings and Cal explains his actions, followed by Cal's departure and Nan's observation of a horse stampede.

sub_scenes.title: Time Skip, Loneliness, and Belated Reunion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers a significant time skip and Nan's experience of loneliness during Cal's absence, culminating in a belated reunion and Cal's confession of his long-held feelings.

Major_Arcs.title: Weather Crisis and Community Response
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to an external crisis - a severe snowstorm impacting the community. It portrays the concerns, reactions, and eventual community-driven solution to the weather emergency, alongside the evolving relationship between Nan and Cal.

sub_scenes.title: Lingering Feelings and Weather Report
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with Nan and Cal continuing their conversation amidst a snowy backdrop, followed by the introduction of the severe weather condition and its immediate impact.

sub_scenes.title: Growing Concerns and Narrative Exposition
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows escalating concerns about fodder and the potential long-term impact of the snow, combined with narrative exposition emphasizing the severity and relentless nature of the snowstorm.

sub_scenes.title: Despair, Hope, and Emotional Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene portrays Cal's decision to act amidst the crisis, followed by a night of despair and hopelessness, and then a sudden shift to hope with the arrival of a plane carrying aid, leading to an emotional resolution between Nan and Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: Arrival of the Plane

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Rising Tension
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new storyline and character, Chane Benson, shifting focus to a Western town setting and depicting confrontations, public opinion, and escalating tension around Benson's reputation and actions.

sub_scenes.title: The Cowboy's Confrontation and Public Skepticism
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Chane Benson through a dramatic confrontation in town and immediately contrasts this with skeptical and mocking reactions from bystanders, questioning his heroic image.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Family Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Jeff and his sister, focusing on her concern about his growing gun obsession and their escalating confrontation regarding their father's gun and Jeff's behavior.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Mr. Benson and Ominous Advice
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Mr. Benson and his ominous advice regarding Chane Benson, setting a darker tone and foreshadowing potential danger and violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Ominous Advice and Mention of Violence

sub_scenes.title: Public Outcry and Direct Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts public discussion about an article criticizing Chane Benson, leading to Benson's direct and threatening confrontation with the article's publisher, Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Public Discussion about Chane Benson's Reputation and Article
Confrontation and Warning in the Office

sub_scenes.title: Defiance and Dinner Invitation Strategy
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Clyde's resolute decision to continue publishing despite threats, and the subsequent strategy of inviting Chane Benson to dinner as a potential way to de-escalate the conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Determination to Publish Articles Despite Threats
Public Reaction to Clyde's Articles and Jeff's Insight
Considering a Dinner Invitation for Chane Benson
Awkward Dinner and Jeff's Demonstration for Chane

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Tension and Revelation of Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene continues the dinner and shifts to an outdoor confrontation between Sally and Chane, escalating accusations and culminating in Sally's angry confrontation with Jeff, revealing a sense of betrayal.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Accusation and Chane's Evasive Response
Escalating Accusations and Threat of Violence
Sally's Confrontation with Jeff about Betrayal
Sally's Outburst and Accusation of Manipulation

sub_scenes.title: Dominance, Departure, and Urgent Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts misunderstandings, Chane's assertion of dominance, Sally's emotional reaction and resolve, and the urgent realization of danger to Clyde, leading to Jeff's determined pursuit.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Danger and Urgent Action
Confrontation with the Editor and Townsmen

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Reflection on Journalism
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers the escalating confrontation with townsmen, flashbacks to office tension, and ultimately a resolution where Chane Benson leaves town, followed by reflection on courage and decency in journalism.

narrative_arcs.title: Flashback to Clarion Office - The Ticking Clock
Flashback - Uncertainty and Fear Behind the Door
Reflection on Family, Courage, and Decency in Journalism

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley and Ranch Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new storyline focused on Betsy's ranch and Steve Daley's arrival as hired help, depicting initial confrontations, escalating ranch troubles, and Betsy's complex feelings towards Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Encounter and Hiring
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene starts with a physical confrontation and then introduces Steve Daley, hired by Hank, to Betsy, establishing Steve's new role as the boss.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley to Betsy
Confirmation of Hiring and Foreshadowing Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Settling In and Ranch Troubles Revealed
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Steve settling into the ranch, followed by Betsy and Hank discussing Steve's character and Hank revealing the ranch's troubles and potential range war.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Steve's Character and Past

sub_scenes.title: Journey to Town and First Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Betsy and Steve's journey to town, Betsy's lingering distrust, and their confrontation with Fred Bridges, escalating the ranch conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Journey to Town and Lingering Doubts
Leaving the Store and Betsy's Sarcasm
Aftermath of the Punch and Further Threat
Discussion on Gunfighters and Hornets' Nest

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Internal Conflict and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Betsy's reflection on Steve, her initial decision to fire him, her reconsideration, and her internal conflict between her values and romantic feelings, leading to a romantic resolution with Steve.

Major_Arcs.title: Valley Conflict and Betsy's Stand
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on the escalating conflict over the valley, involving Old Man Bridges and Hank, and Betsy's firm stance against gun violence, leading to a confrontation at Devil's Pass.

sub_scenes.title: Land Dispute and Escalating Tensions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Old Man Bridges' complaint, Hank's accusations, and Betsy and Steve's confrontation, escalating the tension and setting the stage for a potential violent conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Old Man Bridges' Complaint and Hank's Accusation
Betsy and Steve's Confrontation and Steve's Challenge to Hank
Betsy's Stand Against Gun Violence and Concern for Steve
Steve's Reflection on Past Mistakes and the Ambush

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Betsy's resolve to act, her ride to Devil's Pass, and the eventual arrival at the pass, leading to an emotional resolution and future outlook for Betsy and Steve.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Parting and Betsy's Worried Reflection
Betsy's Command and Ride to Devil's Pass
Arrival at Devil's Pass and Ominous Recognition
Betsy's Recovery and Reassurance by Steve

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Fred, and Range Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new set of characters and a range conflict, focusing on Carrie's complex relationships with Fred and Dave, and the unfolding drama around the Carlton Contract and ranch ownership.

sub_scenes.title: Protecting Dave and Range Encroachment
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene starts with a woman arguing to protect Dave and then shifts to the ranch setting where Curley's arrival signals a range conflict with Bar 'C' ranchers.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubled Arrival and Range Conflict
Explaining the Fence and Herd Concerns

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Confrontation and Gun Draw
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Fred Gordon's arrival and polite but tense inquiry about the fence, quickly escalating into a potential gunfight with Curley drawing his gun.

narrative_arcs.title: Fred Gordon's Polite but Tense Arrival

sub_scenes.title: Past Apology and Conflicted Feelings
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene includes a flashback to a past apology involving Carrie and Fred, followed by Carrie and Dave's conversation revealing Carrie's conflicted feelings for Fred and Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie and Dave's Conflicted Feelings about Fred

sub_scenes.title: Present Confrontation and Romantic Flashback
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene returns to the present with Fred confronting Carrie, followed by Carrie and Dave's conversation and a flashback to Carrie and Fred's romantic proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Present Confrontation: Fred Gordon and Carrie
Carrie's Confession and Dave's Attempt to Reconcile

sub_scenes.title: Deceit, Rejection, and Confrontation with Carlton
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals Fred's contract-driven proposal, Carrie's angry reaction and accusation of deceit, her rejection of Dave, and her resolve to confront Mr. Carlton about the contract.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Wisdom on Love and Life
Carrie's Relief and Reflection on Fred
Mr. Carlton's Arrival and Carrie's Misinterpretation
Revelation of Fred's Sacrifice and Brother's Intervention
Carrie's Emotional Awakening and Ride to Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance's Confrontation and Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Dirk's return and the confrontation with Marshal Rance Cready, depicting Dirk's injury, escape, and eventual reconciliation with Rance, culminating in Rance's marriage proposal to Chris.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Return and Injury Revelation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with Dirk's dramatic return and cryptic announcement, followed by the revelation of his gunshot injury and medical examination.

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Pursuit Initiation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Dad's concern and plan to investigate Dirk's situation, followed by the arrival of Marshal Rance Cready and the initiation of his pursuit.

narrative_arcs.title: Marshal Rance Cready's Arrival and Initial Inquiry
Confirmation of Pursuit and Denial of Dirk's Presence
Rance Cready's Insistence and Proof of Dirk's Presence

sub_scenes.title: Compromise, Reunion, and Realization of Love
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers Marshal Cready's discovery of Dirk and the negotiated delay for Dirk's recovery, leading to an unexpected reunion and realization of love between Chris and Rance.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Injured Dirk and Assertion of Law
Rejection of Excuse and Acknowledgment of Change
Argument, Confession and Confirmation of Love
Rance's Internal Conflict and Realization of Misjudgment
Rance's Decision, Departure Announcement and Realization of Manipulation

sub_scenes.title: Escape, Pursuit, and Final Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the escape attempt, the pursuit by the Marshal, the confrontation, shooting, and immediate aftermath, leading to a moral dilemma.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern about the Marshal and Reassurance
Realization of Pursuit and Urgent Escape
Argument on Handling the Injured Person

sub_scenes.title: Departure, Reflection, and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the forced departure leaving Rance behind, Chris's reflection on her love for Rance, her return to him, and the final romantic climax with a marriage proposal and kiss.

narrative_arcs.title: Forced Departure and Concern for the Injured
Woman's Reflection and Understanding of Love for Rance
Return to Rance and Confrontation about Injury
Father's Departure and Hint at Private Matters
Expression of Gratitude and Love Confession
Rance's Reflections on Marriage and Dirk
